newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arafat in Cairo, starts Mideast talks with Mubarak.
newsitem.headline: Arafat in Cairo, starts Mideast talks with Mubarak.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Aaraft arrived in Cairo on Saturday and went straight into talks with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak on Egypt's attempt to break the deadlock in Israeli-Palestinian relations.
Egyptian Prime Minister Kamal Ganzouri and Foreign Minister Amr Moussa are also attending the talks at Mubarak's office in northeastern Cairo, officials said.
President Mubarak is at the centre of mediation to bridge the gap between Israel and the Palestinians, mainly over Jewish settlement actitivity in Arab East Jerusalem.

Diplomatic sources said on Friday that Egypt and the Palestinians were working on a five-point plan which includes a freeze on any change in the status of Jerusalem and a ban on Jewish settlement of the West Bank for "a sufficient period".
In return the Palestinians would give a firm commitment to address Israel's security demands, they added.
But the sources said the gap between the two sides remained very wide, especially on the question of Jewish settlements.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has refused to go back on a decision to build 6,500 homes for Jews on an East Jerusalem site known to Israelis as Har Homa and to Palestinians as Jabal Abu Ghneim.
Moussa said on Thursday it was premature to talk about any openings on the part of Israel, particularly since the Jewish state outlined a vision for peace in which Palestinians are largely sidelined.
